snippet: Chinese cars are growing in popularity in countries like Brazil, Russia and Saudi Arabia, where buyers are more interested in low cost than in Western brands.
abstract: Chinese cars are growing in popularity in emerging market countries like Brazil, Russia and Saudi Arabia, where buyers are more interested in low cost than in Western brands; China exported 850,000 vehicles in 2011, up 50 percent from 2010; so far, however, the quality of the best Chinese cars has been well short of their Western counterparts, leaving even many Chinese customers dissatisfied.

byline.contributor: Aaron Nelsen contributed reporting from Santiago, Chile.

lead_paragraph: Chinese cars are growing in popularity in countries like Brazil, Russia and Saudi Arabia, where buyers are more interested in low cost than in Western brands.

headline.seo: Valuable Gains for China in Emerging Auto Markets
headline.main: Chinese Cars Make Valuable Gains in Emerging Markets
headline.print_headline: Cheap Chinese Cars Make Valuable Gains in Emerging Markets
